TEST.0.title: 2024 North Carolina Division B Regional 4
TEST.0.customHeader:
Names of participants: (Please print neatly)

School Name:

Check your team: ◻ Varsity ◻ JV1 JV2 ◻ JV3

Warning: Do not open this packet until given permission to do so.

Note: There are useful notes after this page.

CIPHER.108.cipherString: There is no such thing as work-life balance. Everything worth fighting for unbalances your life.
CIPHER.108.question: Decode this quote from Alain de Botton which has been encoded with an Aristocrat Cipher.
CIPHER.108.author: Alain de Botton

CIPHER.113.cipherString: Better ask twice than go wrong once.
CIPHER.113.question: The following German Proverb needs to be decoded with the Affine Cipher where a=11 and b=9.
CIPHER.113.author: German Proverb

CIPHER.125.cipherString: Put time and effort to promote your personal brand.
CIPHER.125.question: A quote by Abhishek Ratna has been encoded using the FractionatedMorse Cipher for you to decode. You are told that the quote has YOUR in it corresponding to the encoded text F W N I P Y.
CIPHER.125.author: Abhishek Ratna

CIPHER.111.cipherString: All ambitions are lawful except those which climb upwards on the miseries or credulities of mankind.
CIPHER.111.question: Decode this quote from Joseph Conrad which has been encoded with a Caesar Cipher.
CIPHER.111.author: Joseph Conrad (Teodor Josef Konrad Korzeniowski) 1857-1924

CIPHER.116.cipherString: Even if yestur-day was wildly sew cess-full, I still doughnut want to re-peat it. Ratter, I want to bild on it.
CIPHER.116.question: Decode the message from Craig D. Lounsbrough which was encoded with a K1 Aristocrat Cipher (after being run through a ‘sus' dictation system).
CIPHER.116.author: Craig D. Lounsbrough

CIPHER.123.cipherString: People come and go but birthdays do accrue.
CIPHER.123.question: The following strange headlines encode a quote by an unknown source using a Baconian cipher. You are told that the deciphered text contains DAYS somewhere.
CIPHER.123.author: Unknown

CIPHER.126.cipherString: Stop waiting for the perfect day or the perfect moment... Take THIS day, THIS moment and lead it to perfection.
CIPHER.126.question: Decode this quote from Steve Maraboli which has been encoded with an Aristocrat Cipher.
CIPHER.126.author: Steve Maraboli

CIPHER.120.cipherString: Why do people ask me if I'm hiding , if I was hiding you wouldn't see me!
CIPHER.120.question: Solve this quote from an unknown source which has been encoded with the Atbash Cipher.
CIPHER.120.author: Unknown

CIPHER.112.cipherString: Look forward to failure. Fail quickly. If it does not start with Failure it is probably not meant to be
CIPHER.112.question: A quote from David Sikhosana has been encoded using the K1 Aristocrat Cipher for you to decode. You are told that it ends with TO BE.
CIPHER.112.author: David Sikhosana

CIPHER.124.question: The following cryptarithm provides the key to decoding the values 1540897 56321. What do they decode to?

CIPHER.118.cipherString: Covetousness, like jealousy, when it has once taken root, never leaves a man but with his life.
CIPHER.118.question: A quote by T. Hughes has been encoded using the K1 Aristocrat Cipher for you to decode.
CIPHER.118.author: T. Hughes.

CIPHER.130.question: The following quote by Albert Einstein needs to be decoded with the Affine Cipher where a=5 and b=7.
CIPHER.130.author: Albert Einstein

CIPHER.132.cipherString: People often belittle the place where they were born but heaven can be found in the most unlikely places.
CIPHER.132.question: A quote by Mitch Albom has been encoded using the K1 Aristocrat Cipher for you to decode. You are told that it ends with ACES.
CIPHER.132.author: Mitch Albom

CIPHER.122.cipherString: Your life is your story, so make choices that will write it the way you want it to be written
CIPHER.122.question: Decode this quote from Brooke Stonex which has been encoded with the Complete Columnar Cipher.  You are told that it contains the letters RYSOMAK.
CIPHER.122.author: Brooke Stonex

CIPHER.114.cipherString: Our mistakes, when met with awareness and personal responsibility are actually what introduces us to our best selves.
CIPHER.114.question: A quote by Cleo Wade has been encoded using the K2 Aristocrat Cipher for you to decode. Solve this quote by Goethe that has been encoded as a Patristocrat using a K2 keyword.  You are told that it ends with ELVES.
CIPHER.114.author: Cleo Wade, Heart Talk: Poetic Wisdom for a Better Life

CIPHER.121.question: The following cryptarithm provides the key to decoding the values 8635 89145 97082. What do they decode to?

CIPHER.110.cipherString: Life is beautiful. Cherish every moment, appreciate what you have, and find joy in the present.
CIPHER.110.question: Decode this quote from Vitaly Magidov Kirkpatrick which has been encoded with an Aristocrat Cipher.
CIPHER.110.author: Vitaly Magidov Kirkpatrick

CIPHER.117.cipherString: Every time I've done something that doesn't feel right, it's ended up not being right.
CIPHER.117.question: Decode this quote from Mario Cuomo which has been encoded with the Complete Columnar Cipher.  You are told that it contains the letters SEND.
CIPHER.117.author: Mario Cuomo

CIPHER.129.cipherString: La felicidad es la lluvia fina y suave que penetra en el alma, pero que después brota en manantiales de lágrimas.
CIPHER.129.question: Solve this Xenocrypt which is a translation of a quote by M. de Guérin into Spanish and has been encoded with a K1 alphabet using an English keyword. It contains the word ALMA.
CIPHER.129.author: M. de Guérin
CIPHER.129.translation: Happiness is the fine and gentle rain which penetrate the soul, but which afterwards gushes forth in springs of tears.

CIPHER.128.cipherString: Help stamp out, eliminate and abolish redundancy!
CIPHER.128.question: The following odd symbols were found on a sheet of paper when a tomb was opened, but you recognized it as the Baconian alphabet, written by a prankster. It turns out to be a quote from an unknown source. What does it say?
CIPHER.128.author: Unknown

CIPHER.115.cipherString: Life doesnt give you what you want; it gives you a version of what you can have.
CIPHER.115.question: The following quote by Iain Cameron Williams needs to be decoded with the Nihilist Substitution Cipher with a keyword of DRUGS and polybius key of BIOTECHNOLOGY.
CIPHER.115.author: Iain Cameron Williams, The Empirical Observations of Algernon

CIPHER.131.cipherString: Adults are always asking little kids what they want to be when they grow up because they're looking for ideas.
CIPHER.131.question: A quote by an unknown source has been encoded using the K2 Aristocrat Cipher for you to decode.
CIPHER.131.author: Unknown

CIPHER.119.cipherString: Not being excited is to have missed the whole point of life.
CIPHER.119.question: The following letters encode a quote by Steve Chandler using a Baconian alphabet. What does it say?
CIPHER.119.author: Steve Chandler

CIPHER.127.cipherString: It's always a good idea to make friends with babies. That's free cake once a year for a lifetime.
CIPHER.127.question: The following quote from an unknown source needs to be decoded with the Nihilist Substitution Cipher with a keyword of WAVE and polybius key of RADIOTHERAPY.
CIPHER.127.author: Unknown

CIPHER.109.cipherString: Never bend your head. Hold it high. Look the world straight in the eye.
CIPHER.109.question: The following quote by Helen Keller needs to be decoded with the Porta Cipher with a keyword of STAR.
CIPHER.109.author: Helen Keller
